alert.note: Alert for Bacon; Coffee; Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 12:26PM EDT until August 30 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bacon County in southeastern Georgia... Southeastern Coffee County in southeastern Georgia... Northwestern Ware County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 1226 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated Hurricane Idalia producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by Idalia. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Douglas, Alma, Broxton, Nicholls, West Green, Bickley and New Lacy. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
